REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session instance. Defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • email – Filter the query

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first contact found by the email address

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_name(contact_name, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_name function returns a list of contacts that match the contact_name parameter.

Parameters:

  • contact_name – Filter the database query

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

All contacts with the name specified in the contact_name parameter

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_surname(contact_surname, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_surname function returns a list of contacts with the given surname.

Parameters:

  • contact_surname – Filter the query

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given surname

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthdays(db: Session)¶

The get_contacts_by_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Find the contact in the database

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactModel): The updated contact information. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – Get the contact from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

async src.repository.contacts.validate_birthday(brth: date)¶
The validate_birthday function takes a date object as an argument and returns the number of days until that birthday.

If the birthday has already passed this year, it will return the number of days until next year’s birthday.

Parameters:

brth – date: Pass the user’s birthday into the function

Returns:

The number of days until the user’s birthday

Doc-author:

Poznanskyi

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Set user’s e-mail confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User’s e-mail

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Not return result.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Create user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User body.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Get user by e-mail.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User’s e-mail.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Return the found user, or None if it does not exist

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → None¶

Update user’s avatar

Parameters:

  • email (str) – User’s e-mail.

  • url (str) – User avatar link.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Updated user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update user token

Parameters:

  • user (User) – Current user.

  • token (str) – User’s token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Not return result.
